quoteFirst: Looking from the camp, the hill had a long-topped aspect with rather an abrupt western termination. During the night the weather was showery and this morning rain fell, accompanied by a strong north-east wind. Left camp at
quoteLast: and reached the base of Fort Bowen in four and a half miles at 10.25. In coming that distance we crossed plains which had, near the river, more herbs than grass; and near the hill more grass than herbs.
title: Journal of Landsborough's expedition from Carpentaria, in search of Burke & Wills
author: Landsborough, William, 1825-1886

quoteFirst: She will be taken to be older than she really is, which may be a disadvantage to her.—2. The expression “teens” is taken from the termination of the numbers
quoteLast: teen inclusive, and “hazel” is brown, like the brown of the hazel nut. We go to press long before you receive your magazine, and we are sorry you have to wait so long for replies.
title: The Girl's Own Paper, Vol. XX, No. 1029, September 16, 1899
author: Various

quoteFirst: It was the sort of generalized, picturesque "fluff-stuff" matter which Banneker could handle better than his compeers by sheer imaginative grasp and deftness of presentation. Being now a writer on space, paid at the rate of eight dollars a column of from
quoteLast: teen hundred words, he found the assignment profitable and the test of skill quite to his taste. Soft job though it was in a way, however, the unrelenting pressure of the heat and the task of finding, day after day, new phases and fresh phrases in which to deal with it, made inroads upon his nerves.
title: Success: A Novel
author: Adams, Samuel Hopkins, 1871-1958

quoteFirst: You’ve got a magnificent big house--far too large for a bachelor like you.  You’ve got a lady-housekeeper whose manifest propriety is so stupendous that even Paddy is awed by it--a lady, I am sure, estimable in every respect--and you have fifty boys ranging from
quoteLast: teen.  Oh, yes! and I forgot the worthy Paunch and Val.  Now if you can’t, amongst you, look after my little girl for six months you ought to be ashamed of yourselves.
title: Master and Maid
author: Harker, L. Allen (Lizzie Allen), 1863-1933

quoteFirst: A candidate is also an artificial thing. If he lives and works in his constituency, the daily vision of an otherwise admirable business man seated in a first-class carriage on the
quoteLast: train in the same attitude and reading the same newspaper may produce a slight and unrecognised feeling of discomfort among his constituents, although it would cause no such feeling in the wife whose relation to him is 'natural.
title:
Human Nature in Politics
Third Edition
author: Wallas, Graham, 1858-1932

quoteFirst: Minerva House, conducted under the auspices of the two sisters, was a ‘finishing establishment for young ladies,’ where some twenty girls of the ages of from
quoteLast: teen inclusive, acquired a smattering of everything, and a knowledge of nothing; instruction in French and Italian, dancing lessons twice a-week; and other necessaries of life. The house was a white one, a little removed from the roadside, with close palings in front.
title: Sketches by Boz, Illustrative of Every-Day Life and Every-Day People
author: Dickens, Charles, 1812-1870

quoteLast: teen years; their height from five feet ten to six feet three; their muscularity and their sturdy self reliance not at all.
title: Westover of Wanalah: A story of love and life in Old Virginia
